page.title: 14Lois Weedon School
page.content: {LOIS WEEDON SCHOOL}is church assisted with 18 pupils at present, 5-11 years. Built in 1846, together with a head- master's house & later extended to cater for 75 pupils. It has one full time & one part time teacher. Although very small it is popular with & part of the local community. Very young children do not have to catch a bus to school. The children benefit from individual attention, teachers knowing them & their families. The shy child, bully or pupil with difficulties does not go unnoticed. However children have fewer personal contacts & may miss out on team games, though link-ups may be made with other small schools. Less equipment is available; it has a computer but has to make do with outside toilets. At 11 students then have to travel to the local Comprehensive Schools.
